Description: Sherd (base). With sub-Sultanabad stylised prunus spray and inscription. Made of black painted and cobalt stained and reserved pattern pottery (buff).
Curator's comments: On pottery with this signature: Y. Kanda, "Revisiting the So-called Ghaybī Workshop: Toward a History of Burjī Mamluk Ceramics", Orient 52 (2017) 39-57
Bibliographic references: Gibbs 1994 / Mamluk Underglaze-Decorated Wares: Some Evidence from Fustat (fig.77)
